H0.text: Chemical is the form into which electrical energy changes when Trevor turns on a lamp.

H1.text: Light is the form of energy that electrical energy changes into when Trevor turns on a lamp and the lamp is on.

H2.text: Mechanical is the form of energy that electrical energy changes into when Trevor turns on the lamp and the lamp is on.

H3.text: Potential is the form of energy that electrical energy changes into when Trevor turns on a lamp.

A4.text: With the development of electric lights and power systems, electric lighting has effectively replaced firelight.

A5.text: Incandescent light bulbs emit only around 10% of their energy as visible light and the remainder as infrared.

A6.text: Electric heating is an example of converting electrical energy into thermal energy.

A8.text: An incandescent light bulb, also known as an incandescent lamp or incandescent light globe, is an electric light that produces illumination by Joule heating a filament until it glows.

A9.text: Incandescent lamps are nearly pure resistive loads with a power factor of 1.
